title: Intermittent Lag Spikes (NOT DUE TO ISP)
body:
Hello all,

I usually do not post on the forums but it would appear I have an issue that even I can't seem to find the solution to.

I consider myself to be very educated in the computer world yet this one has me stumped.

I get intermittent lag spikes that always seem to come up when other champions come into play (mainly enemies where we team fight). I have gathered information and performed many home remedies but cannot seem to resolve it. I am sitting at ~37 ping all the time and then it shoots through the roof (sometimes at 1500-1600) for no reason. I have Time Warner Cable internet with 35MB down and 6MB up. I have done plenty of internet speed tests and packet tests. When I ping google, everything comes back fine after hours of running the test. When I ping the RIOT server that is in Chicago (the one I connect to when playing) it runs fine for hours with no issues. Yet, when I get into a game (it can even be a custom with all bots) and go into a team fight the ping spikes continue.

I have opened all ports and set all priorities. I have tried having nothing running except for league and still the problem persists. I do not have a virus I can assure you this and no spyware either.

I am at my wit's end and have no idea where to go from here. Any suggestions?

I have an i7, GeForce 760ti, new 500gb SSD, 12GB RAM. Running Windows 10 (yes I have tried compatibility mode).

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body: I too have been having nasty lag spikes since patch 6.7.

I actually have this EXACT same issue. I'm fine for ARAM, but the second I step on to The Rift, I usually get about 5-7 minutes of intermittent 1000-1500 ping, then it returns to normal for good the rest of the game

I also have the same TWC plan, but my computer is slightly less powerful and am running windows 8.

It's really weird that this doesn't happen on ARAM, though.

Heyo,

Have you tried running a trace route to our game servers before, during, and after a game to see if there are any noticeable differences? A trace route would allow us to see what specific hops your data is taking to get to our servers, and where the ping increases may be coming from. Look here:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#wq2

Make sure to use the free trace route download (The WinMTR link), instead of typing tracert into Windows Command Prompt. The WinMTR trace will provide packet loss, and can be run over a long time frame, so it should be better for tracking purposes!

> [{quoted}](name=Morgageddon,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=s8K17I4p,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-04-15T20:08:58.239+0000)
>
> Heyo,
> 
> Have you tried running a trace route to our game servers before, during, and after a game to see if there are any noticeable differences? A trace route would allow us to see what specific hops your data is taking to get to our servers, and where the ping increases may be coming from. Look here:

> 
> Make sure to use the free trace route download (The WinMTR link), instead of typing tracert into Windows Command Prompt. The WinMTR trace will provide packet loss, and can be run over a long time frame, so it should be better for tracking purposes!

Let me know if you need anything else.

OK so I have not completed everything fully but what I can tell from initial observation is the WinMTR tool consistently shows my highest ping hop and packet loss (~3800ping/ 2-5% packet loss during spikes) being from the following server:

"cpe-75-185-48-1.columbus.res.rr.com"

I am unsure of what I can do since this is a ISP owned server. What do I tell them to do in order for them to fix it on their end?

I called TWC and told them that I looked everywhere else and that it had to be on their end and they said from the 2 week history of my modem, no packet loss was detected. Either that is a load of babyback BS or something very odd is going on here.

Any ideas @Morgageddon?
I am working on gathering the data that Morgageddon requested. I will post an update with this information today.
I should also add that this does not happen with any other electronic device or website. Ie. Netflix works fine on the Xbox and the computer both without any drop in service.
